New Records: This is the first ever T20I match ended without a single six in India.
91: Yuzvendra Chahal became the leading wicket-taker for India in T20Is, surpassing the previous record of 90-wickets by Bhuvneshwar Kumar.

India chased 101 for the fourth wicket in 19.5 overs, their ninth lowest successful run-chase in T20 International and their lowest chase against New Zealand in T20Is, previous lowest was 133 at Auckland in 2020.
New Zealand's 99 was their joint eighth lowest score in a completed innings in T20 international and their worst-total against India in T20Is, previous lowest was 111 at Kolkata in 2021.
Key Match Events: An unbeaten 31-run stand for the sixth-wicket between Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya helped India to a hard-fought six-wicket victory over New Zealand in a low-scoring thriller.
Spinners attack dominated the match with 30 overs out of 40 bowled by spinners between India and New Zealand in a T20I match.
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav named Player of the match for his match-winning superb unbeaten 26 off 31-balls including a boundary.
Miscellaneous Highlights: 30: Number of overs, out of 40 bowled by a spinners between India and New Zealand in an T20I match - This is the second most overs bowled by a spinners in an T20I match after 33-overs bowled by between Cayman Islands and USA at Hamilton in 2019.
